Description: Part of a jar-seal: of black clay, with an impressed inscription giving the name of Djer, together with the standard of Wepwawet. Also on the seal are a number of other hieroglyphs.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl.XV, 109; H. R. Hall, 'Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs etc. in the British Museum: Volume 1 : Royal scarabs' (London, 1913), 287, no.2756; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964), pl.47, abb.175A; see also vols. I, 76 and II, 738, n.347; 1115; B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' V (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 78.
